title: RAK13006 WisBlock CAN Module Datasheet > RAK13006 WisBlock CAN Module Datasheet > Overview > Description > RAK13006 CAN Bus Module Overview
content: RAK13006 is a CAN Bus communication module based on the MCP2518FD CAN controller and ATA6563 CAN transceiver both from Microchip. The MCP2518FD is the CAN chip that communicates to WisBlock Core MCU via SPI up to 17MHz SPI Clock Speed and ATA6563 is the low-level physical layer chip that provides a physical connection with the CAN bus communication lines. It supports both CAN 2.0B and CAN FD with an arbitration bit rate up to 1Mbps. This WisBlock Interface module is ideal for industrial and
parent_content: RAK13006 is a CAN Bus communication module based on the MCP2518FD CAN controller and ATA6563 CAN transceiver both from Microchip. The MCP2518FD is the CAN chip that communicates to WisBlock Core MCU via SPI up to 17MHz SPI Clock Speed and ATA6563 is the low-level physical layer chip that provides a physical connection with the CAN bus communication lines. It supports both CAN 2.0B and CAN FD with an arbitration bit rate up to 1Mbps. This WisBlock Interface module is ideal for industrial and automotive applications.

title: RAK13006 WisBlock CAN Module Datasheet > RAK13006 WisBlock CAN Module Datasheet > Overview > Description > RAK13006 CAN Bus Module Overview
content: an arbitration bit rate up to 1Mbps. This WisBlock Interface module is ideal for industrial and automotive applications.
parent_content: RAK13006 is a CAN Bus communication module based on the MCP2518FD CAN controller and ATA6563 CAN transceiver both from Microchip. The MCP2518FD is the CAN chip that communicates to WisBlock Core MCU via SPI up to 17MHz SPI Clock Speed and ATA6563 is the low-level physical layer chip that provides a physical connection with the CAN bus communication lines. It supports both CAN 2.0B and CAN FD with an arbitration bit rate up to 1Mbps. This WisBlock Interface module is ideal for industrial and automotive applications.

title: RAK13006 WisBlock CAN Module Datasheet > RAK13006 WisBlock CAN Module Datasheet > Specifications > Overview > Mounting > RAK13006 Module Mounting on WisBlock Base Board
content:
The RAK13006 module can be mounted on the IO Slot of a WisBlock Base board. **Figure 1** shows the mounting mechanism of the RAK13006 on a WisBlock Base board, such as the RAK5005-O, and **Figure 2** shows the terminal crimp connector.  
> **Image:** RAK13006 WisBlock CAN Module mounting  
> **Image:** RAK13006 Crimp Terminal Connector and Terminal Resistance Switch
parent_content:
The RAK13006 module can be mounted on the IO Slot of a WisBlock Base board. **Figure 1** shows the mounting mechanism of the RAK13006 on a WisBlock Base board, such as the RAK5005-O, and **Figure 2** shows the terminal crimp connector.  
> **Image:** RAK13006 WisBlock CAN Module mounting  
> **Image:** RAK13006 Crimp Terminal Connector and Terminal Resistance Switch

title: RAK13006 WisBlock CAN Module Datasheet > RAK13006 WisBlock CAN Module Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Chipset > RAK13006 Component Vendor and Part Numbers [TABLE]
content:
| Vendor                          | Part Number |
| ------------------------------- | ----------- |
| Microchip (CAN Controller)      | MCP2518FD   |
| Microchip (CAN PHY Transceiver) | ATA6563     |

title: RAK13006 WisBlock CAN Module Datasheet > RAK13006 WisBlock CAN Module Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Pin Definition > RAK13006 WisBlock CAN Module Pinout Definition
content:
The RAK13006 WisBlock CAN module comprises a standard 40-pin WisConnector. The WisBlock 40-pin connector allows the RAK13006 module to be mounted on a WisBlock Base board. The pin order of the connector and the pinout definition is shown in **Figure 3**.  
> **TIP:** NOTE
- 3V3_S supply pin
- SPI-related pins
- IO5 connected to interrupt pin  
> **Image:** RAK13006 WisBlock CAN Module pinout diagram
parent_content:
The RAK13006 WisBlock CAN module comprises a standard 40-pin WisConnector. The WisBlock 40-pin connector allows the RAK13006 module to be mounted on a WisBlock Base board. The pin order of the connector and the pinout definition is shown in **Figure 3**.  
> **TIP:** NOTE
- 3V3_S supply pin
- SPI-related pins
- IO5 connected to interrupt pin  
> **Image:** RAK13006 WisBlock CAN Module pinout diagram
